description:
Gauche Suede is on his last delivery before a big promotion. In the outskirts of Yodaka, the darkest area of Amberground, Gauche is surprised to find that the package is a young boy named Lag Seeing. Lag had been traumatized by his mother's abduction and is due to be delivered to his aunt. In this remote area rife with Gaichuu, Lag and Gauche face a dangerous journey that inspires Lag to become a Letter Bee.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asadercover)

Best known for his fantasy series [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/manga/31709/).
He's a Japanese musician and singer-songwriter from Tokyo.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

[Website](http://ryokunihiko.com/)

Started taking piano lessons at age of 5. Attended in medical college about 3 years. From 1984 to 1985 he worked in a Tokyo hospital. After that he moved back to musical career. In 1996 he made his first solo album “The Gate Of Dreams”. 1998 second album “Into the Light”. “ONLY HEAVEN KNOWS” in 1999. 4th album “Pan-O-Rama” 2001. 2004 5th solo album ECHOES. He also made sountracks to DEAD HEAT,Emma,The Twelve Kingdoms and many more.

[Oficial Website (archived)](https://web.archive.org/web/20111117010926/http://www.himeka.info/)

Catherine St-Onge, also known by her stage name HIMEKA, is the winner of the Second Annual Anime Song Grand Prix. She originally uploaded covers of Japanese songs to YouTube and moved from Canada to Japan in 2008 in order to start her singing career. Her blog posts are usually written in both Japanese and English and occasionally French as well.
Angelo is a japanese rock band consisting of キリト(Kirito) on vocals, KOHTA on bass and TAKEO on drums; all former members of PIERROT.

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

Originating from Ashi Productions.

Tsutomu Miyazawa is an animator, storyboard artist, character and mechanical designer formerly affiliated with [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/).
Tsutomu Miyazawa is an animator, storyboard artist, character and mechanical designer formerly affiliated with [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/).

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
